remarks: Extension by continuity.  Proposition 11 of [BourbakiTop1] p.  II.20. Given a topology ` J ` on ` X ` , a subset ` A ` dense in ` X ` , this states a condition for ` F ` from ` A ` to a space ` Y ` Hausdorff and complete to be extensible by continuity (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 4-Dec-2017.)
statement:
cnextucn.x $e |- X = ( Base ` V ) $.
cnextucn.y $e |- Y = ( Base ` W ) $.
cnextucn.j $e |- J = ( TopOpen ` V ) $.
cnextucn.k $e |- K = ( TopOpen ` W ) $.
cnextucn.u $e |- U = ( UnifSt ` W ) $.
cnextucn.v $e |- ( ph -> V e. TopSp ) $.
cnextucn.t $e |- ( ph -> W e. TopSp ) $.
cnextucn.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. CUnifSp ) $.
cnextucn.h $e |- ( ph -> K e. Haus ) $.
cnextucn.a $e |- ( ph -> A C_ X ) $.
cnextucn.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> Y ) $.
cnextucn.c $e |- ( ph -> ( ( cls ` J ) ` A ) = X ) $.
cnextucn.l $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X ) -> ( ( Y FilMap F ) ` ( ( ( nei ` J ) ` { x } ) |`t A ) ) e. ( CauFilU ` U ) ) $.
cnextucn $p |- ( ph -> ( ( J CnExt K ) ` F ) e. ( J Cn K ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d F x $.
$d J x $.
$d K x $.
$d ph x $.
